column4: Hey question.. say I already dualboot and I wanna give the 64-bit version a go. I already have my drives partitioned and everything... When I install the 2nd linux operating system on my machine, does GRUB reconfigure for me automatically to show the new 64-but kernel?
Did you get my last message to you?
mised it
yes, it does
So then when os would be in charge of grub, the new one or the first installed one?
the last installed os
That is what I was thinking .. ok thanks
if you want a different one to do it, while that os is active do  sudo grub-install /dev/hda (or sda)
um,  sudo update-grub && sudo grub-install /dev/<device> that is, so all the os's will be listed
got it thanks bro
he has the latest libdvd and all that?
yes, it's not even seeing his dvd's. None of them are. Errors opening them
Is there a preferred file system to use for setting up a share that ubuntu users and windows users can access?
Is there a preferred file system to use for setting up a share that ubuntu users and windows users can access?
sorry, I forgot to answer. On the same machine? ntfs is good enough, you can use fs-driver.org for ext2 if you like. samba for between machines
hi
I suggested the proprietary driver manager
good choice
he said he did it that way but the 3d test failed..? ATI...
I let floodbot be the arbiter of that these days. The uber-ops set that :)
hehe ;-)
